intro: Malanea parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered malanea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Malanea parviflora is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
